revised_title: Self-Consistent Perturbation Theory for Impurities and Imperfections in Metals
tldr: The authors develop a self-consistent perturbation theory for impurities and imperfections in metals, focusing on the Dirac density matrix. They obtain exact self-consistent results for the density and potential distribution around an impurity to first order in perturbation theory, covering a density range sufficient for all metals under normal conditions. This approach reveals long-range oscillations in the self-consistent density and potential.
